title: Residential Construction Coordinator
content:
As an Residential Construction Coordinator you will impact lives of children, families, and senior adults through supporting Buckner's Humanitarian Aid Center by planning, coordinating and taking leadership of any construction related projects, especially related to the Buckner Healthy Housing program.  You will be responsible for driving excellence and ensuring projects are designed, budgeted, bid and constructed on time, within budget and to a high-level of quality and customer satisfaction in alignment with Buckner’s mission, vision, and values.
Buckner International is a faith-based nonprofit dedicated to transforming the lives of orphans, vulnerable children, families, and senior adults in the United States and internationally. Founded in 1879 in Dallas, TX, we protect children, strengthen families, transform generations, and serve seniors. If you have a passion for helping others in an uplifting and supportive environment, this job is for you!  
Our 5 STARS Perks:

Medical and Dental benefits for associates and their eligible dependents.
Payactiv, early access paid wages
Life insurance.
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability benefits.
Paid Time Off and Holidays.
Paid Parental Leave.
Retirement Savings Plan.
Associate referral program.
The 5 STARS Fun Benefit: encourages associates to spread good cheer to their co-workers and others, creating a happy, healthy environment for all!

You will make a difference by:

Coordinate and supervise the construction of homes in the Buckner Healthy Housing program from the conceptual development stage through final construction on a timely and economical basis. Includes coordination of the supply of materials, equipment, and tools required for project completion. 
Ensure construction projects are in alignment with applicable building codes and/or permitting as local laws require. 
Supervise any contracted labor as required for construction projects. 
Assist in developing construction management strategies that will result in effective and efficient execution of projects.
Organization and maintenance of home build cohort networks from year to year.  
Organize and manage construction related inventory by purchasing, receiving, warehousing, packing and shipping aid.  Inspect and monitor physical condition of facilities and furnishings, tool trailers and tools. 
Plan, develop, and coordinate mission experiences.
Support the planning, tracking and reporting of essential metrics to ensure the success of Buckner Missions goals and objectives.
Assist in developing policies and procedures for specific programs and promoting safety awareness to staff, interns, volunteers, and mission groups. 
Maintain compliance with internal and inter-departmental procedures.
Liaison to community; speak in public on behalf of Buckner.  Responsible for supporting and representing Buckner at special events, activities and other assigned functions. 
Perform special assignments, projects, and other duties as required. 

What you’ll bring to the team:

Minimum 3 years prior related experience in residential construction field required.
Requires in-depth knowledge of construction techniques, construction science and construction materials.  
High School Diploma (or G.E.D.) required; Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
Ability to speak, read and write both English and Spanish.
Provide strategic and logistical planning and facilitate meetings. 
Organize complex tasks and plans and to be detail oriented. 
Requires ability to drive assigned vehicle(s) or personal vehicle, with appropriate state license, following all laws applicable; must provide proof of liability insurance and must be eligible to be insured under Buckner’s insurance policy. Must be age 21 or older to drive on behalf of Buckner. 
Travel to various geographic locations and some overnight stays.  
Use up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force continuously to move objects and/or people. 

EEOThe same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Buckner is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, ​age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Buckner.
